verses.verse: There <S%H3426><s%> is an evil <S%H9567><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> and it is prevalent <S%H7227><s%> among <S%H5921><s%> men <S%H120><s%> –

a man <S%H376><s%> to whom <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> and wealth <S%H5233><s%> and honor <S%H9202><s%> so that his soul <S%H5315><s%> lacks <S%H2638><s%> nothing <S%H369><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> that he desires, <S%H183><s%> but God <S%H430><s%> has not empowered <S%H7980><s%> him to eat <S%H398><s%> from them, for a foreigner <S%H5237><s%> enjoys <S%H398><s%> them. This <S%H2088><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a severe <S%H7451><s%> affliction. <S%H2483><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> fathers <S%H3205><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> [children] and lives <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> however many <S%H7227><s%> they be, but his soul <S%H5315><s%> is not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with good <S%H9186><s%> things, <S%H9186><s%> and he does not even <S%H1571><s%> have <S%H1961><s%> a [proper] burial, <S%H6900><s%> [then] I say, <S%H559><s%> "Better <S%H2896><s%> the miscarriage <S%H5309><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> he,
for it comes <S%H935><s%> in futility <S%H1892><s%> and goes <S%H1980><s%> into obscurity; <S%H2822><s%> and its name <S%H8034><s%> is covered <S%H3680><s%> in obscurity. <S%H2822><s%>
"It never <S%H3808><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> and it never <S%H3808><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> [anything;] it is better <S%H5183><s%> off than <S%H4480><s%> he.

"Even if <S%H432><s%> the [other] man lives <S%H2421><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> twice <S%H6471><s%> and does not enjoy <S%H7200><s%> <S%H9186><s%> good <S%H9186><s%> things <S%H9186><s%> – do not all <S%H3605><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> place <S%H4725><s%>?"
All <S%H3605><s%> a man's labor <S%H5999><s%> is for his mouth <S%H6310><s%> and yet <S%H1571><s%> the appetite <S%H5315><s%> is not satisfied. <S%H4390><s%>

For what <S%H4100><s%> advantage <S%H3148><s%> does the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> have over <S%H4480><s%> the fool <S%H3684><s%>? What <S%H4100><s%> [advantage] does the poor <S%H6041><s%> man <S%H6041><s%> have, knowing <S%H3045><s%> [how] to walk <S%H1980><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%>?

What <S%H4758><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> see <S%H4758><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> what the soul <S%H5315><s%> desires. <S%H1980><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is futility <S%H1892><s%> and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>

Whatever <S%H4100><s%> <S%H7945><s%> exists <S%H1961><s%> has already <S%H3528><s%> been named, <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8034><s%> and it is known <S%H3045><s%> what <S%H834><s%> man <S%H120><s%> is; for he cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> dispute <S%H1777><s%> with him who <S%H7945><s%> is stronger <S%H8623><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> he is.
For there <S%H3426><s%> are many <S%H7235><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> which increase <S%H7235><s%> futility. <S%H1892><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> [then] is the advantage <S%H3148><s%> to a man <S%H120><s%>?

For who <S%H4310><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H120><s%> during [his] lifetime, <S%H9132><s%> [during] the few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H3117><s%> of his futile <S%H1892><s%> life <S%H9132><s%>? He will spend <S%H6213><s%> them like a shadow. <S%H6738><s%> For who <S%H4310><s%> can tell <S%H5046><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> will be after <S%H310><s%> him under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>?
